alert.note: Alert for Caledonia (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 4:54PM EST until December 19 at 9:34AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and northeast Vermont, including the following counties, in central Vermont, Orange and Washington. In northeast Vermont, Caledonia. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 453 PM EST, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the warned area, with portions of US 2 closed due to flooding. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 1.75 and 2.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Barre, Montpelier, Marshfield, Plainfield, Marshfield Village, Calais, East Montpelier, Orange, Groton, Cabot Village, Barre Town, Cabot, Barre City, Websterville, Woodbury, Peacham, Washington, Berlin, Williamstown and Walden. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
